Hi German,

> I would like to know what xml format for networks nevt supports.
> Is it the supported spec somewhere on http://nevt.sourceforge.net/  ?

I put together a user guide that should help you through downloading
and using NEVT.  It's available through the website, and is also
included in the distribution.

Basically, when you download the .zip file for NEVT and extract it,
there are four directories:

/complexity
/fitness
/network
/species

They correspond to the four types of visual output NEVT generates.  In
each directory there is a sample XML file, along with a DTD,
indicating the format needed to generate images.

I don't necessarily consider the current XML formats finalized.  I'd
really like to get more feedback from anyone interested in using NEVT,
and hopefully over the next few months we can improve it.

> Is it the same as the latest proposed xml spec for NEAT available in yahoo
> groups?

No, it's slightly different.  But not very much so.  

The nice thing about XML, though, is that once we settle on a standard
format, it's reasonably simple to convert old formats to new ones with
XSL.  I don't mind helping with the style sheets necessary for people
to convert their XML to the one supported by NEVT, as it goes through
version changes and settles on a standard.

> Thank you for nevt!

No problem.  I realize some people are reluctant to use unfamiliar
technologies, but the intent was really to put together something that
was platform-independent, fairly easy to use, and save others the time
and energy of coding graphical output for their implementation.

Anyway, if you have any more questions...just let me know.

Derek
